answers.answer: Did they test your mouth for thrush? When you have the gurgling is there any pain?

It's a shame you have to wait weeks to get in to the Dr. Did they say why your bilirubin might be higher than normal? I'm sorry I could'nt have been more help to you. I do understand what it's like to have stomach issues. It's awful for anyone going through it.

None of the docs made any comments about the bilirubin. Also, I noticed that my white blood count went from 4.6 in September to 5.4 in December. Is that amount of change normal or is it something I should bring up in my GI appointment?

question: For the last 7  months I have developed a number of bizarre symptoms that I cant seem to shake.  I am usually a healthy guy and rarely get sick.In August, I developed what I think was a sinus infection coupled with digestive issues (multiple loose bowel movements every morning) within about 10 days the sinus symtoms cleared up (without antibiotics), but the digestive symtoms stayed.I also developed a white coating on my tongue that seemed to get worse with sugar. When I avoid sugar my tongue clears up and digestive symtoms slightly lessen but don't disappear.I have a loud gurgling stomach, increased belching and flatulance (although not a huge amount). My mouth symtoms also include dry/slightly sore mouth and some white mucusy strings on the back of my throat.So far all blood tests and the stool sample are normal. Negative H-Pylori, negative, negative thyroid issues, negative diabetes. Slightly high bilirubin. Also a swab culture on my tongue was negative for fungus.I'll finally be getting in to see a GI in a few weeks, but I could really use some advice about what this might be. It's ruining my life.
title: White Tongue and Digestive Symtoms
